titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Norman Holmes Pearson Collection of "Art for the Wrong Reason"
Pearson (Norman Holmes) Collection of "Art for the Wrong Reason"
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:42

did.unittitle: Norman Holmes Pearson Collection of "Art for the Wrong Reason"

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

langmaterial.language: Captions in English, French, and German.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Norman Holmes Pearson Papers (YCAL MSS 899), Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Norman Holmes Pearson (1909-1975)
bioghist.p: Norman Holmes Pearson (Yale 1932, 1941 PhD), professor of English and American Studies at Yale University and officer in the United States Office of Strategic Services during World War II. Pearson collaborated with Yale University Library curator Donald Gallup to develop the Yale Collection of American Literature, playing an instrumental role in the library's acquisition of the papers of H. D. and Bryher.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Norman Holmes Pearson Collection of "Art for the Wrong Reason." Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains sixty-three sketches, drawings, paintings, and prints acquired by Yale faculty member Norman Holmes Pearson not for their aesthetic or artistic merit, but because they were created by poets and other authors; he titled his collection "Art for the Wrong Reason." The works were executed in crayon, gouache, graphite, ink, charcoal, oil, and watercolor on paper, board, canvas, and panel, by fifty-three writers including E. E. Cummings, George Du Maurier, Victor Hugo, D. H. Lawrence, and Katherine Anne Porter, with multiple works by John Dos Passos, H. D., Herman Hesse, Denise Levertov, Wyndham Lewis, John Masefield, Henry Miller, and William Makepeace Thackeray. Among the drawings are portraits, self-portraits, or caricatures of G. K. Chesterton, Hugh Hefner, Henry Miller, J. M. Mitchison, Norman Holmes Pearson, Bernard Shaw, and Osbert Sitwell.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Chiefly bequest of Norman Holmes Pearson (Yale 1932, 1941 PhD), 1975. Other additions noted at folder level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inscribed "For Norman Holmes Pearson, this American Study of the stroke magazine publisher Hugh Hefner, offered with a deep bow and a tip of the hat, by Tom Wolfe Christmas 1974."
